name: Verifying where the custom status appears
objective:
Verifying where the custom status appears in:

  • LHS Header

  • Post Header for Posts in Center Channel/RHS

  • LHS Channel list.

  • DM Header

  • Direct Messages modal

  • Manage/View members modal

  • Channel members Popover

  • Autocomplete UI

  • User popover

  • Channel Switcher
precondition:
• Logged in
  • Custom statuses enabled on the server

customFields.Cypress Reports: UNSTABLE - TM4J-Key-Mapped-In-Cypress-Unstable - TM4J key found Cypress master-unstable run report  (SDET/QA)

inline.description:
1. Open the "Set a status" modal
  2. Click in the "Set a status" text field, enter a status text and select an emoji
  3. Click on Set Status
inline.expectedResult:
• "Set a status" modal is dismissed
  • Custom status is successfully set
Custom status emoji is shown next to the username in the LHS header

inline.description: Create a post in a channel
inline.expectedResult: Custom status emoji is shown in the post header

inline.description: Click the reply button on the previously created post
inline.expectedResult: Post opens in RHS and the custom status emoji is shown in the post header

inline.description: Click on the username on the created post
inline.expectedResult: User popover opens and shows the full custom status

inline.description: Click on the Members icon in the channel header
inline.expectedResult: Channel members popover opens and shows the custom status emoji next to the username

inline.description: In the Channel Members popover, click on "View/Manage Members"
inline.expectedResult: Channel Members modal opens and shows the custom status emoji next to the username

inline.description: Click on the hamburger menu in the LHS header > "View/Manage Members"
inline.expectedResult: Team Members modal opens and shows the custom status emoji next to the username

inline.description:
1. Click on the + button for Direct messages
2. Search for yourself (the logged-in user)
inline.expectedResult: Custom status emoji is shown next to the username in the Direct Messages Modal

inline.description: After the previous step select yourself and click "Go"
inline.expectedResult:
• DM opens in the center channel and the full custom status is displayed in the DM header
  • DM is created in the LHS Direct Messages section and the custom status emoji is shown next to the username

inline.description:
In the channel text input field, type:
/message [username]
inline.expectedResult: Autocomplete shows the user along with the custom status emoji

inline.description:
1. Click CMD/CTRL+K to open the find channels modal
2. Start typing your username
inline.expectedResult: Custom status is shown in the find channels modal, on the right, in-line with the name
